Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: anton_barr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Terrasse room at the seventh floor so I can't say much about other rooms. Our room was absolutely fabulous with a giant terrasse with a magnificent roof top view of Barcelona. The location was beyond amazing, the hotel is clean as a whistle, and the staff is so nice and helpful... I wish I could go there again! My wife is sensitive to Gluten and I sent an email about it to the hotel. Boy, were they ready and helpful!!! I regret I didn't write down the names of the breakfast staff so I could personally express our thanks for all their care and help. Great job guys, you certainly made us feel at home in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: jaawaa
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on proximity to the Aerobus (Plaza Catalunya) and other reviews on this site. I think I made a good choice. Stayed here for 2 nights in April 2012. I booked a single room, but they made a mistake and gave me a double (but didn't charge me extra). Room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was big and good shower strength. Walls are definitely thin, can hear your neighbors and outside street noise. But I wore earplugs, so no problem. Staff was friendly. Very convenient to Las Ramblas and other main attractions. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were great, room over priced I thought.”
Reviews.Author: anne w
Reviews.Content: I think if you were looking at a hotel close to la ramble this is around the corner. I thought there was not much on offer at this hotel for the price. No coffee/tea provided. Our bed were two singles moved together. Road outside was very noisy and the room was well sound proof but aircon was not cooling at all. I was disappointed. The staff were helpful and that was nice. Don't buy food on the la ramble, they see a tourist from a mile away. Go to the little streets away from the main traffic for a good deal. The market not far from hotel sells wonderful things to eat and the fresh juices are to die for, just one euro a cup.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JoNunis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid March. We had the room with balcony on 5th floor. Quite spacious for the two of us. The room came with free wifi and the standard amenities. We found it convenient as it is along Las Ramblas street and nearby Metro station. Hard Rock was also walking distance. And there is also a tourist information counter along the Las Ramblas street. Just nxt to the hotel is a nice bar with good tapas called Bar Lobo and we ate there twice! The hotel receptionists are helpful in providing assistance on tourist information. The first night we arrived, they helped to make reservation for Flamingo dance show which is just 10 mins walk from the hotel. They also sell the hop on & off bus passes which we bought fr 2 days pass. We had the room facing the street so it can be noisy until 1-3am so we couldn't open the balcony glass door for the cool air as it was pretty noisy. We used the aircon instead. We are happy with the room condition and the services as we were only in the room during the night after a day out sight seeing. We managed to find a self service laundry just nearby street fr the hotel so we managed to get our clothes washed as we came from a week in Italy. The laundry is a bit hidden, got to walk almost end of the street to be noticed. Some tips on Barcelona : becareful with your belongings especially when taking out luggages from taxi/car...never leave it out of your sight as its common for snatch thieves to just walk along and carry your bags off!! While we were there, we experienced young tourists reporting stolen bags. Do visit Montserrat for a day tour. Lovely scenery and if one is adventures, can walk to a spot with a cross for good view. Walk take about an hour to go up & back. And make sure to buy online tickets to Sagrada Familia church as the queue is pretty long!! More than an hour to get in. If taking the metro, buy the 10 trip pass for €9.30 and can be used for few people. We bought a ticket and shared for 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “All-round OK”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere07
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, simple rooms, contemporary design, great breakfast, WIFI. Provided what I needed - a decent place to sleep in a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: Cameron F
Reviews.Content: Great location. The hotel is located in central of city . You could walk everywhere. Air condition was good. The room was very clean. I was generally pleused turin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte P
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for my 21st in October. The hotel was lovely, very clean, rooms not huge but perfect for us everything was immaculate! The hotel is in a great location just down a side road off La Ramblas. I would recommend this hotel 100% :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely three days”
Reviews.Author: ahru
Reviews.Content: We( my 40 year girlfriend and me) stayed in this very central hotel during 16-19 December 2011 . It is very central ,neat, fairly priced. The hotel is fifty steps to Las Ramblas.It has good restaurants near by. The rooms are small and they don't have a closet but since we only used the room after eleven o clock,to sleep ,it was not a problem for us. The staff is always helpful and smiling.We really enjoyed Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ewoudus
Reviews.Content: very helpful staff. The location is the hotel is very good: near the Ramblas and near 2 metro stations. We used the metro a lot and It is a really easy and fast way to travel.

Reviews.Title: “City Centre Gem - Hotel Turin Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Roger James M
Reviews.Content: Small yet clean and efficiently run hotel in a great location within metres of los Ramblas. Reception staff were friendly and helpful as were the restaurant staff. Reasonably priced, especially considering its location. Would recommend it to anyone seeking good service and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Jobisaglia
Reviews.Content: Location: perfect Staff: very helpful Could have: refrigerator in the room but there is one at the lobby and carrefour market is 20 m away. Tip: I preferred having breakfast at the Ramblas instead of paying 12 euros at the hotel. Don't know if the breakfast at the hotel is good but you will find at least 10 different coffe shops around the corner. Tip to get to the hotel from the airport: aerobus, a blue bus you will find in terminal 1 and 2 and you leave you in Cataluna Square > 5,30 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Homely environment in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: paddymc999
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights as a family. Fantastic location, close to the Ramblas. Many excellent dining options close by and the hotel itself has a wonderful outdoor platform for relaxing or reading, just off the reception area. Rooms are an unusual design but very functional and well kitted-out.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly front desk”
Reviews.Author: travelsmiles2011
Reviews.Content: good value for money. i was also very happy for the free internet. i loved my room it was big and the view was perfect. i had a room on the 7th floor with deck twice the size of the room. with a perfect view. i loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Millie085
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Hotel Turin. The location was brilliant - just a few minutes away from the lively La Ramblas. The hotel was perfect for a couple of days away, the room was probably a little small for a longer stay. The room was clean and well equipped, and we particularly liked the sun terrace which was next to our room. The only slight complaint might be the noise in our room from the water pipes - but to be honest, we were so exhausted after experiencing the busy city-life of Barcelona that we didn't care!!

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 night stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EvaA1
Reviews.Content: We had the room on the top foor which had a lovely little balcony. This hotel is just off La Rumbla and in perfect proximity to all city attractions. Everything was perfect. We had a supermarket just across the street. The market just around the corner. The beach just a shor bus ride away! Small and very cosy hotel with all amenities + aircon! Loved it! would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saqrajan
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room at Hotel Turin and we were concerned about the space (3 beds) but all concerns were gone the moment we entered the room..it was fabulous. Extremely clean, wonderful bathroom amazing room all together. It was super quite as well given how close it is to La Ramblas (1 min walk). The staff were super the whole hotel was very quiet and professional decor. We were 3 guys and I would def book this hotel again when I re visit Barcelona with my fiancée! There was an electronic safe as well which was key for us! and it was free to use.. there was free internet as well and one of their computers was a mac which was pretty impressive compared to the other hotels I visited. We felt very safe and would highly highly recommend this hotel if you want to be near La Ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “All you need!”
Reviews.Author: Max_co_nl
Reviews.Content: Reading a lot of negative reviews about this hotel made us very curious... But we have to say: non of the negative reviews matched our experience! It is a fine & clean hotel, the rooms are of a good size, beds/matrasses are of a good quality, bathrooms nice & clean, and breakfast is simple but more than enough and the choice is adequately. The staff is very helpfull & friendly. Only 'negative' apsect maybe the noise disturbance, but there's no more noise than can be aspected in a big city that never sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “No Compaliants”
Reviews.Author: WexfordBaggie
Reviews.Content: Great location for our three night stay. Despite other comments we had no issues with noise and sleep. In summary a very decent hotel and no complaints. Best compliment -would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, if not a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: logic3d
Reviews.Content: The location is unquestionably great. The staff were friendly, and the prices are by no means extortionate. The hotel was however quite noisy during our stay, and any small noise from the corridor was clearly audible from within our room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close to the Action!”
Reviews.Author: JannieAnn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights post-cruise and wanted to stay closer to the main tourist area to make the best use of our time. Triple rooms can be tricky to find so were pleased the Turin was available. Minimalist decor meant it was very clean (my daughter is allergic to dustmites and she didn't sneeze once!). Room big enough to accommodate us and our bags. Great shower, In-room safe, free Wi-Fi, close to Ramblas and easy walk with luggage from Placa Catalunya. Short walk to Bouqueria market for breakfast! A great experience. Even though its a tourist area you still mix with the locals. We loved it and want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Romangirl79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turin hotel 3 nights in september. Best thing in this hotel is location: only 50 meters from the Rambla, and about 200 mt from the Plaza Catalunya metro, perfect if you don't wanna rent a car and move by public transports.. About the hotel: very kind staff, a little old building and also the rooms furniture, small but clean bathroom, air conditioning well working. If you want you can have also breakfast at the nearby bar but we preferred trying the spanish breakfast in the bars around the rambla. Maybe a little overpriced (100 euro per night, a double room), but i think it's because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BeniRef
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience with the hotel. The location is great, the rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff was very cooperative and helpful. One feature that we greatly appreciated was that the hotel has easily accessed lockers where one can store luggage and reaccess it without the need of assistance from the hotel staff. This is very useful on the last day when you buy stuff and want to store it. Internet access in the room was free and the hotel provided us with an Internet cable. There are also computers available in the lobby for Internet access for those that don't arrive with a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Clean, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: sandrai
Reviews.Content: Wonderful & helpful staff. Nice private patio for hotel guests. Walk to all. Free usage of 2 computers in lobby. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Keeto69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Turin Hotel for two nights before joining a cruise ship. The hotel is in a brilliant location on a side street just off the Ramblas. Our room was at the back looking into a courtyard and was very quiet, you would never believe you were only a couple of minutes away from the Ramblas. Our room was very large with a kingsize bed and there was also two pull down beds which would be ideal for friends sharing or a family. Although the rooms aren't luxurious, they had everything you need for a short stay and were spotlessly clean. The bathroom is like the American style with the sink separate from the toilet and bath/shower. There was also a safe in the room and air conditioning and there is also free internet downstairs by the reception. If you are arriving at Barcelona airport, the best was to get into the city is by the airport bus. The service is very good with frequent buses and only costs 5 euros 5 cents. It takes about 20-30 mintutes and you can get off at Placa Catalunya. You just walk down the Ramblas on the right hand side and when you come to the Le Meridian hotel turn right and the Turin is on the opposite side of the road. We didn't eat in the hotel but there are plenty of places in the vicinity for breakfast etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PhilaTraveller
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in a good location. The only problem I had was we inadvertently booked for 2 nights instead of 3 and although they had room in the hotel they charged me an additional 25 Euros for the extra night even though they didn't have to pay a booking fee to a 3rd party for that night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stonica
Reviews.Content: We stayed here post-cruise back in May and had a great stay. The room was large and equally important clean. Very modern looking. Shower had great water pressure! Since we were so close to the Ramblas, it did get a bit loud at night, but this also made it extremely convenient to walk everywhere. The front desk staff was friendly and made taxi arrangements for us on our day of departure without a problem. The internet connection worked well. Would recommend and would probably stay there again if were are ever lucky enough to return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: asmad69
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights from 1st august 2010. the hotel in very clean and modern. staff are very friendly and helpful. they also speak great english. the rooms have air conditioning. not the biggest room i have ever stayed in, but not too small. a decent enough size for a room in the city centre. all very modern with wood panneling and glass walls. the beds were comfortable and large. it's pretty quiet in the hotel, we stayed in a room at the front. no noise at all from outside when the windows are closed. just usual city street sounds when they were open, although this hotel is on a reasonably quiet street considering its only 50 yards from la rambla. free internet downstairs, but i was able to pick up the hotel wireless from our room as well as other free internet from nearby places. everything in the city centre is within easy walking distance from the hotel. we would definately recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Very Modern Rooms, Tastefully done”
Reviews.Author: alzybaby
Reviews.Content: For anyone trying to find a hotel to accommodate a family of 5 in one room, I hope this is of huge help to you. When we travel anywhere I spend days on the web trying to find such hotels, so when we choose Barcelona after a very very long search I finally found Hotel Turin who agreed to take 2 adults and 3 kids under 12 in the same room. Firstly a big big WOW on the location. Its literally on the Ramblas but enough paces to cut down on some of its wonderful hustle and bustle and noise. You really couldn't do any better on location. Then you enter the hotel and its very modern, very clean and friendly. Basically a very welcome sight. The short corradoors to the rooms are very modern with the doors almost flush with the walls. Anyone sick of looking at endless corridors of oak architraves and oak doors will be refreshed. Once inside the room is very very cleverly laid out. Almost all the lighting is recessed and the pull down beds are very clever. Even the frosted sliding door into the loo is ultra modern and all about saving space. So, though the rooms are small, just like most Barcelona hotel rooms, you don't feel it at all - and that's saying something with two adults and three kids inside!! Flat screen TV, very responsive Air Con, in-room Safe, all go to bring this hotel beyond most 3 star city hotels. There's even a small communal decked roof terrace (safe and enclosed enough if you have kids with you) which lets you get a feel of urban living among the older surrounding buildings and apartments which overlook it. The car park is right next door, and if you simply pay in the hotel upon departure you get a decent discount and pay only €18 per day. And, to top it all off, not 10 paces from the front door of Hotel Turin are the first of all the wonderful things about Barcelona, pavement-side cafes and bars ready to serve you some of the finest coffees, beers and tapas while you watch the world go by, contemplating which next cafe you'll stop at. All things considered, value for money, cleanliness, rooms and of course location, you simply cant go wrong. Personally I couldn't recommend this hotel higher - I just hope you have as great a time as we did. I'll definitely be returning to Hotel Turin next time we're in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Group of 15”
Reviews.Author: rsd_83
Reviews.Content: A group of 15 stayed at Hotel Turin end of April 2010. Rooms are very nice, clean, tidy and excellent value for money. Great location and walking distance to pretty much all main attractions! Only negative was 1 of our rooms being accussed of making too much noise 1 night and receptionist threatening to call the police. However, when the receptionist knocked on the door the guests were asleep and he confirmed this the next morning. But for some reason still adamant we were making the noise....don't make sense i know, but all in all did not let that ruin what was a nice confortable stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Great Location, Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: sun_life_shine
Reviews.Content: We booked Turin Hotel for our travel group of 3 couples based solely on Tripadvisor's reviews. A big thank to all of you! It turned out to be a good choice! Fantastic Value As Barcelona is a world class conference destination, good accommodation does not come cheap, particularly near La Rambla . Hence Turin Hotel is a hidden gem considering its reasonable rates ( comparatively). While we agree that it is not a plush hotel with grand ballrooms and spa- it is a clean and modern hotel . Its bathrooms were fairly spacious and clean with a bathtub and a shower- you could not expect grand bathrooms in Europe, not in a 3 star hotel. It was definitely bigger than the bathrooms in our Paris and London hotels. The hotel has a small elevator which was big enough for our luggages. The internet was free but it might be limited to their computers at the lobby. The rates did not include breakfast but there are so many cafes nearby that you do not have to worry about getting your morning coffee. It was good enough for us. Great Location The hotel is located less than 5 minutes walk from La Rambla, in a quiet but safe street ( which was a great concern for us as we had read that La Rambla can be unsafe at times). Food: At the beginning of the street you would find Le Meridien hotel and a posh Chinese Restaurant ( with a lovely paper origami like giant dragon) . The small square next to the hotel has about 3 restaurants including one very classy one which seemed very popular with the locals. One night we had a night drink at the square and watched very good acrobatic dance moves performed by street artists.The tapas bar across the Hotel is not bad for a quick bite but there are so many other dining options nearby so you could give this one a miss. Carrefour is 2 minutes away from the hotel which means you could get your essentials anytime at reasonable prices. A quick stroll on La Rambla would lead you to Mercat Le Boqueria- a great place for breakfast and lunch . Must trys are Pinotxo Bar and El Quim. Everything is sold at the mercat ( pastries, bread, cheese, fruit drinks, chocolates, biscuits etc ) so you could also pick up a few items for breakfast/lunch/snack on the go, particularly when you are going on a long sightseeing trail. For photos of and travel tips on the mercat and Barcelona pls check out http://sunlifeshinefree.blogspot.com/. Attractions: La Rambla, Barri Gothic, the Port Vell and the Placa de Catalunya to name a few are all within walking distance of the hotel. Public Transport: The metros are very near and so are the bus stops. Helpful Staff The staff in Turin Hotel were friendly and helpful. We bought our Bus Turistic tickets and the flamenco show tickets from the reception. They also helped us with our car rental to Girona. If we return to Barcelona, we would stay in Turin Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Mandywales
Reviews.Content: An excellent city centre hotel. The hotel is just off La Rambla in an superb location. If possible I would ask for a high room ( there is a lift) this avoids the city noise that you undoubtedly get from being so central. Rooms are modern, spacious and very well serviced every day. Bathrooms are a little on the small side - but a great shower and lovely big towels. Staff were helpful and polite. Free internet in the lobby. Downsides are that there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. This is a great hotel for a city break, I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again. one word of warning ..... Barcelona is a very expensice city and dont eat on La Rambla .... poor food and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, staff and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Augusto26
Reviews.Content: We spend the new year's holiday in Barcelona and stayed in Hotel Turin. The hotel is very close to Las Ramblas, and you can reach Catalunia Plaza and Paseo dela Gracia by foot. I strongly recommend the hotel. Didn't tryed the breakfast, and the hotel provides free internet. Next time on Barcelona, Hotel Turin.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: illymail08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable for a family of four. During the "winter time" there is not AC available, so windows have to be open; this creates a problem with the outside noise especially late at night during garbage pickup. Very clean. Front desk staff not the friendliest, it was OK for the price and centric location. I couldn’t get a cup of coffee if I was not having breakfast in the hotel for €11 .00. Needless to say I didn’t have breakfast at the hotel. We found the most charming café “Bar the Pi” with excellent service and the greatest coffee. For about €20.00 we eat breakfast with sandwiches “bocadillos” coffee or any other pastries. The advantage of the hotel is that accommodates up to four people per room which is a rarity in Europe, but I would look harder for another one next time that would offer the same accommodations. Hotel Turin Barcelona 11/2009.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: seagull__IL_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Turin hotel for a holiday with my wife. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Barcelona for vacation: Excellent location - this hotel is located right next to "La Rambla", yet it is quiet and you can get a decent good-night rest. The hotel was recently renovated and the rooms are modern, clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would especially recommed Katy from the reception desk who was very kind and helpful. There are two free internet posts - this tirned out to be a nice advantage. We did not order breakfast, and I think it is not necessary - there are so many places to eat in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the LUXE, just a great clean place with a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: DiegoMarc
Reviews.Content: This is not the Ritz, nor the W , if you are looking for a hotel with all the comforts home cross the street and check into LE Meridien. This is a hotel for the urban travler. Clean, Secure and a GREAT LOCATION. Rooms facing the front of the street tend to be a bit bigger and def comfortable when travelling with friends. The location is 80 feet from the Ramblas, and right smack in the middle of everything. On the border of the Raval, you get the real side of BCN if you leave the hotel and walk to the left, if you long for tourist packed streets and ugly tshirts and mugs leave the hotel and head right. Like in any city watch your stuff bags , purses etc. The hotel is clean and modern, just the perfect size to get home take a nap and leave. If you love to live life and don't spend half your time looking at the map plotting your every move this is a hotel for you. Drop you bags and hit the city, Barcelona is you oyster EAT UP! for more information on the city check out PulsoBCN

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ffiffas
Reviews.Content: Near Ramblas but not in dangerous street. Good Room, comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel and you won't regret”
Reviews.Author: ensingg
Reviews.Content: We (girlfriend and me (40)) were staying there for a short vacation of 4 nights. Its a very good and modern hotel. We stayed in room 702, the most beautifull room with a terrace. The airconditiong was perfect and very silent. No noise from the streets or whatever at all. The breakfast you have to get at the other side of the street, it's a traditional breakfast/tapaz bar. Good food. Nothing to complain, it's good !

Reviews.Title: “Four days in vibrant Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: shelly15
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Barcelona for four days, we stayed in the Turin hotel just off Las Ramlas, the Turin hotel is really right on top of everything, the room was fine, with wood flooring and has a very large barthroom with a great shower, we found the staff very helpful,. Now if your looking for a good place to eat ....Do Not eat on Las Ramblas, unless you eat in the amazing tapas bars., that you will find in the food market 3 minutes from hotel, this is where you will find authentic spanish food ! cooked by spanish chefs ! also we found another great place to eat, it's called Dostrece Barcelona, really really good food and very cheap, turn left out of hotel, check out it's web site www.dostrece.net, ...Do not eat in the restaurant oppersite hotel, awful, but for good coffee, turn right from hotel then first right 2nd restaurant on right, Have a Great Time ..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BristolAna
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our 11 year old grandson for 3 nights room only. The hotel is in an excellent location for bars,restaurants, shops, metro and buses, everything a matter of metres away. Reception very helpful, gave advice and ordered taxis etc, check in and departure quick and efficient. Also free internet in reception. Lift to rooms. We had room 503 on the 5th floor at the front of the hotel. VERY quiet. The room was large, plenty big enough for the 3 of us, spotlessly clean, large safe, comfortable beds, brilliant shower and bathroom with lovely thick towels and the best air con of any hotel we have ever stayed in. We would recommend this hotel. We had a great stay in Barcelona, one of the best cities to visit in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: KSBelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in two months in the Spring of 2008... both times after cruising to Barcelona and then staying to show my friends and family this beautiful city. We found the Hotel Turin on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed with the hotel either stay. The staff was friendly - they spoke English quite well - they made dinner reservations for us and gave us pointers for shopping, dining and touring. Our rooms were basic yet quite functional - beds, closets, cabinets for luggage and desks. The decor is what I would call Scandinavian and was comfortable yet stark. There was good water pressure in the shower. Built in hair dryers and safe in the closet. One trip I stayed with one other person and the other time there were four of us in single beds in the room. I don't think there are many hotels that can accommodate four singles per room. And because of the four per room, the rate was really reasonable. The location of this hotel cannot be beat - it is a half block off of Las Ramblas - close enough for convenience yet not too close for the noise and hoards of people. Hotel Turin is on the same block as a 5 star Hotel and while I didn't go into the expensive hotel, I did not feel that I was missing anything by being at the Turin. Just across the street and about 30 feet away is a full service grocery and a half a block away is the wonderful Mercat de la Boqueria with its wonderful fruit, vegetable,seafood and meat stalls. The displays are works of art in themselves. There are also cafes in the market. The hotel is within walking distance to the Port of Barcelona, the Cathedral and the Gothic Quarter. The hotel has a plan that includes breakfast, but we did not take advantage of that either of my stays... we went to the Market area down the street. Breakfast is the only meal served in the hotel - there are restaurants across the street and next door. The Turin also has luggage lockers for use if you check in or out during hours when rooms are not yet available. I have since recommended this hotel to friends and will definitely stay here my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tess411
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in May. Great position very close to the La Ramblas. Very clean and basic but felt safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaiWeiShi
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Turin, it is a great location, we had a large room on the top floor with a terrace and great bed. Not much on amenities, no drawer space, but shelf space and hangers. Nice bathroom. Desk not very forth-coming, they were polite but did not have much information.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OsloViking
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in nice spot one block from the Rambla. Several nice bars and cafes around next door. The hotel seem to be recently renovated as everything (except breakfast room) was in a modern style. Rooms are modern, but bed in single room was surprisingly small and uncomfortable. Sound proofing to corridor was far from adequate. Staff was very friendly, professional and helpful. Breakfast (continental/british) was surpisingly moderate for a 3-star hotel (a 2-star hotel down the street had a more generous breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cathy056
Reviews.Content: Right off Las Ramblas with a quiet spot to sit outside next door. A contemporary interior. Very clean, spotless. We didn't have the hotel breakfast - Olivia down the street provided cheap and well-tasting food in nice environment. Plenty of other options if you prefer something else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lshirai
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip from Spain. Booked this hotel mainly for the location as it was right along Las Ramblas and very close to the Airport Bus Stop. Location was fantastic as it is on the side street and while it was close to everything, it was still very quiet at night. There was a little noise every night when the garbage trucks came by but this wasn't that big of a deal. Rooms were very modern looking (maybe just renovated?) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. You need a cable to connect to the internet in your room, which the hotel staff graciously lent me. This is a great hotel for someone who wants a nice, clean, moderate price hotel along Las Ramblas but exactly right on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: louise1234
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel over a weekend in april for his birthday. Although a tad pricey for a 3*, it was definitely worth it! The hotel is really nice and clean and very spacious! We stayed in a double room which had a huge bed and a big widescreen T.V. The bathroom was also very nice, clean and spacious. The location is perfect. Just off las ramblas, yet quiet enough for a good nights slepp. In walking distance of everywhere. The tube is just up the road. I would definitely reccommend this to everyone visiting Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: Dicky4u
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel ! Nice modern rooms - great shower ! A/C worked great . Nice staff. Rooms are said to be sound-proof , not quite. Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: isabel74
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It is a very good 3 stars hotel, clean, rooms are nice and new, good location. Near metro, near shops, near restaurants, near supermarket. It was very good, good price/quality. Next time i will stay again in this hotel. I recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a 4-5 day stay”
Reviews.Author: augustus_ita
Reviews.Content: Located at 3 minutes walk from the noisy La Rambla the hotel is quiet and clean, the staff were particularly helpful in giving any kind of information including bus routes, the best beaches, calling taxis. The large room had a balcony on a small square with a couple of bars but there was no disturbing noise from outside when the window (with double glazing) was closed, despite 15,000 Harley Davidsons assaulting Barcelona during our stay! The only niggle I can make is the lack of a fridge in the room, it would have been very useful with the hot temperature we found! Absolutely recommended, I'll surely go back to this hotel the next time I'll be in Barcelona (and considering how beautiful this city is, it won't take long).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Lizlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently situated just off the Ramblas and walking distance from Catalunya Plaza and the aerobus stop. Spotlessly clean but somewhat impersonal rooms, but who cares if it is comfortable Whogoes to Barcelona to sit in a hotel room? Staff not outstandingly friendly apart from the girls but they were helpful via email before arrival. Breakfast is a bit expensive, we didn't try it. Better to have a lie-in and turn right out of hotel and first right for a famous cafe (on the left) and chocolat spot, the name of which eludes me. Opposite there is also a good traditional Spanish restaurant with a good atmosphere & friendly staff. Recommend hotel for value and position especially for first visit. This was my 5th visit to Barcelona and still discovering loads of new things. Some reviews said it was noisy but as usual main noise was from other guests slammings doors in the early hours. I recommend wax ear plugs, also there was a lot of light at night through the glass sliding door to bathroom, so hang something dark over the bathroom window to cut down light levels if you like dark at night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: rszasz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned yesterday from a vacation in Barcelona and Costa Brava. I have booked on hotel website our 3 nights stay in Barcelona after reading favourable comments on TripAdvisor. The Location of this hotel is excellent on a nice side street of Ramblas called Pintor Fortuny full of four star hotels ,away from the noise of Ramblas but very close to all the action. When I booked on line I have requested a quiet room which we did get it when we checked in.We arrived early around 11:30 a.m and we get the room right away. The room was modern and recently renovated , clean ,facing the back of the building and therefore very quiet . The room was not too large but just right for the time we have spent in the hotel. The bathroom was very nice ,very clean and the shower pressure was excellent. The only small issue was that hotel provided a very good quality soap but very small. We did ask reception for additional soap and we did get it right away. The room has a safe which was not easy to handle and almost every time I had to call reception to unlock it. We did always get good response from reception and all our requests were fulfilled. I do have to say that reception staff did smile inspite of the only complain about this hotel I read from other travellers. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel which was an additional 11 euro/person. There is a large supermarket just around the corner on Ramblas about 2-3 minutes walk which opens at 9:30 or 10:00 a.m and close at around 9:00 p.m. where we bought water and breakfast or we get our light breakfast at Starbuck which is on Ramblas around the corner 2-3 minutes from the hotel which opens early. There is a restaurant just across the hotel serving breakfast,lunch,dinner and several tapas in a placa a few steps from the hotel which we did not use.In summary the Hotel Location is excellent and is a nice,clean, modern 3 star hotel ,on a very nice street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: maroon_calling
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, just off Las Ramblas. It is within minutes of the Catalunya metro station. There is a supermarket just round the corner, which is very convenient as I did not try the hotel breakfast. Some staff were nicer than the others. I stayed in a triple bedded room and it was not as small as I imagined. The bathroom was nice and clean, with a brilliant shower. The safe was easy to operate too. My room faced the front of the hotel and it can be very noisy at night, which my friends complained heavily about. Maybe I was too tired so I slept fine. It helps a great deal if you shut the balcony door. The hotel also has a left luggage room, with individual lockers. I find this to be a great feature as some hotels I stayed just have a room where anyone can wander in. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattyinspain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Turin Hotel one night when the other hotel I was at was totally booked. The room was small but clean and comfortable and newly renovated. Excellent location just off Las Ramblas. The rooms are all non smoking. Two English channels on the tv - CNN and EuroSports. The staff was efficient and pleasant. I would definitely stay there again and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly place”
Reviews.Author: duchil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Turin for one night but would not go there again. It is very convenient to the Ramblas which suited us but in other respects the hotel was not for us. The staff NEVER smiled (I have found that at other Barca hotels - perhaps it's us!).We had an early flight on our departure morning and turned up in the breakfast room to be told that coffee (which was all we had time for) was not available unless we paid for the full breakfast. A hotel that does not serve coffee - unbelievable. The room was OK but nothing spectacular for the money. Perhaps if we had agreed to stay longer the overall impression might have been better - though I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunFamilyVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel, very central off the Ramblas ,near plaza Catalunya, yet quiet. Small rooms, but good Air conditioning, TV, and renovated clean bathrooms. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Davidaki
Reviews.Content: Right off the Ramblas, this hotel is right next door to a small plaza with 3 restaurants. The location is perfect and quiet considering you are only steps from the madnass of LAS RAMBLAS. Steps from Plaza Catalunya. The rooms are very modern and clean. The design of the room is very functional and SUPER clean. If you are looking for a hotel where the staff is constantly greeting you and brown nosing this hotel is not for you. The staff acts more like security, after 12 they lock the doors and only let guests in which makes you feel safe. The staff was friendly provided irons, directions, recommendations to nearby places and arranged cabs. Overall If you are spending too much time in the hotel you are really not seeing Barcelona. This is a great place to drop your bags and go enjoy the city- only to come home to a clean well lit modern room.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: stedepi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Turin very good location

Reviews.Title: “not great!”
Reviews.Author: AineMaura
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves without a room for one night during our stay in Barcelona & approached the Tourist Office for help. They booked us into the Turin Hotel which claimed to be 3-star - - By whose standards I'd like to know! The staff behaved like they were desperate to be somewhere else. We were squeezed into an awkward room on the 7th floor with a shabby interior and a new plastic 3-starred shower curtain hiding an ancient tub. It was musty smelling and the air conditioning unit was primative. The location was good, just of Las Ramblas but I wouldn't stay there again unless it was another tight pinch! Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2006, our family of 2 adults and 2 kids in one room, and grandma in another room. The hotel is in an excellent location, near the Ramblas but far enough away from the noise. The rooms were very clean and plenty big enough for us. The air conditioning was really appreciated in the heat of August! The single room was quite noisy at night maybe from a nearby boiler. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: milliebell
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel Turin easily after gettig off the bus from the airport. The location is excellent, just off Las Ramblas, close to Placa Catalunya. Our room had a lovely big balcony, it was quiet, no groups of sceaming schoolkids, and it was clean and tidy. The staff were a mixed bunch. Some were friendly, others not so. I guess it is like that in most places with numerous staff. Most staff spoke some English. I speak Spanish, but my friend does not. Breakfast is served, but we didn't have breakfast so I cannot comment. My only grumble was that when I booked online, I specified a twin room. I did get that, but the two single beds were actually together. I was travelling with a friend, not a partner, and I prefer some distance between the beds. However, I would very happily stay at the Hotel Turin again.

HotelInfo.Name: Turin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Pintor Fortuny 9, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
